page.title: 07TOURISM
page.content: The concept of{Aviemore Centre}was originated by the late Lord Fraser of Allander.It is the most comprehensive holiday complex ever built in Great Britain.Part of it is built on the site of the old Aviemore Hotel,the gardens of which now form the putting green and Strathspey Hotel lawn.The Centre buildings rise against a back- drop of the{Monadhliath Mountains}and almost on the doorstep are the Craigellachie and Cairngorm Nature Reserves.Four luxurious hotels,a Time Share complex,Scandinavian Village, Alpine-style chalets and a touring caravan park between them provide accommodation for over 1900 visitors. The{Centre}has a variety of amenities including:a 721 seat cinema/theatre; exhibition halls;conference/banqueting suites;ballrooms;restaurants,snack- bars and licensed bars.
